intro: Linosyris angulosa, commonly known as the angular linosyris, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in dry, open habitats. Its leaves are narrow and angular, giving it its common name, while its yellow flowers bloom in spring. Linosyris angulosa is often found in coastal and inland regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
